item.title: Linus Torvalds
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.

item.title: Harold Abelson
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs

item.title: John Woods
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.

item.title: Waseem Latif
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Give a man a program, frustrate him for a day. Teach a man to program, frustrate him for a lifetime.

item.title: Keith Bostic
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Perl – The only language that looks the same before and after RSA encryption.

item.title: Edward Berard
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.

item.title: C.A.R. Hoare
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.

item.title: Douglas Rushkoff
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: We are looking at a society increasingly dependent on machines, yet decreasingly capable of making or even using them effectively.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Program or Be Programmed: Ten Commands for a Digital Age

item.title: Kent Beck
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.

item.title: Max Kanat-Alexander
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Some of the best programming is done on paper, really. Putting it into the computer is just a minor detail.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Code Simplicity: The Fundamentals of Software

item.title: Martin Fowler
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.

item.title: Edsger W. Dijkstra
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.

item.title: Ada Lovelace
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: The Analytical Engine weaves algebraic patterns, just as the Jacquard loom weaves flowers and leaves.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Quotes on Dev is a project site for the RED Academy Web Developer Professional program. It's used to experiment with Ajax, WP API, jQuery, and other cool things. :) This site is heavily inspired by Chris Coyier's Quotes on Design.

item.title: Dan Salomon
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code

item.title: Alan J. Perlis
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: It goes against the grain of modern education to teach children to program. What fun is there in making plans, acquiring discipline in organizing thoughts, devoting attention to detail and learning to be self-critical?

item.title: Ketil Moland Olsen
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Kids who are good at traditional school—repeating rote concepts and facts on a test—can fall apart in a situation where that isn’t enough. Programming rewards the experimental, curious mind.

item.title: Robert Nystrom
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Like so many things in software, MVC was invented by Smalltalkers in the seventies. Lispers probably claim they came up with it in the sixties but didn't bother writing it down.

item.title: Robert Nystrom
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Most non-programmers don't think of plaintext like that. To them, text files feel like filling in tax forms for an angry robotic auditor that yells at them if they forget a single semicolon.

item.title: Robert C. Martin
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Truth can only be found in one place: the code.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship

item.title: Michael C. Feathers
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Programming is the art of doing one thing at a time.

item.title: Douglas Adams
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they go by.

item.title: Edsger W. Dijkstra
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.

item.title: C.A.R. Hoare
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: There are two ways of constructing a software design: One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies, and the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies. The first method is far more difficult.

item.title: Bill Gates
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.

item.title: Linus Torvalds
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.

item.title: Donald Knuth
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: People think that computer science is the art of geniuses but the actual reality is the opposite, just many people doing things that build on each other, like a wall of mini stones.

item.title: Ken Thompson
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code.

item.title: Gerald Weinberg
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: If builders built buildings the way programmers wrote programs, then the first woodpecker that came along wound destroy civilization.

item.title: Brian W. Kernighan
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.

item.title: Jamie Zawinski
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think "I know, I'll use regular expressions." Now they have two problems.

item.title: Fred Brooks
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Nine people can't make a baby in a month.

item.title: Edsger W. Dijkstra
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.

item.title: Bjarne Stroustrup
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.

item.title: Anonymous
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.

item.title: Ryan Campbell
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Commenting your code is like cleaning your bathroom—you never want to do it, but it really does create a more pleasant experience for you and your guests.

item.title: Chris Heilmann
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Java is to JavaScript as car is to carpet.

item.title: Paul Ford
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: A computer is a clock with benefits.

item.title: John Carmack
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Programming is not a zero-sum game. Teaching something to a fellow programmer doesn't take it away from you. I'm happy to share what I can, because I'm in it for the love of programming.

item.title: John Romero
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: You might not think that programmers are artists, but programming is an extremely creative profession. It's logic-based creativity.

item.title: Alan J. Perlis
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.

item.title: Jeffery Zeldman
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: HTML is the cockroach that will survive a nuclear winter.

item.title: Gerry McGovern
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: A typical CMS is like a digestive system with no capacity to poop.

item.title: Eric Elliott
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: What you make with your code is how you express yourself.

item.title: Michael Hartung
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Hardware eventually fails. Software eventually works.

item.title: Steve Purcell
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: The Release Uncertainty Principle says you can accurately know what the software will do, or when you will get it, but not both.

item.title: I Am Devloper
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: The barman asks what the first one wants, two race conditions walk into a bar.

item.title: Gary Bernhardt
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Programmer’s motto: “We’ll cross that bridge when it’s burning underneath us.”

item.title: Tom Scott
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Some programmers, when confronted with a problem, think “I know, I’ll use floating point arithmetic.” Now they have 1.999999999997 problems.

item.title: Erik Osheim
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think “I know, I’ll use multithreading”. Nothhw tpe yawrve o oblems.

item.title: Jason Coyle
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Some people, when confronted with a problem, think “I know, I’ll use versioning.” Now they have 2.1.0 problems.

item.title: Ned Batchelder
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Some people, when faced with a problem, think, “I know, I’ll use binary.” Now they have 10 problems.

item.title: Filipe Fortes
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.

item.title: Mike Hoye
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Unix will give you enough rope to shoot yourself in the foot. If you didn’t think rope would do that, you should have read the man page.

item.title: Steve Haflich
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: When your hammer is C++, everything begins to look like a thumb.

item.title: James Shore
item.dc:creator: mrred
item.content:encoded: Do; or do not. There is no //TODO
